description: A layer object may allow overrides on popup content and drawing behavior for individual layers of a web service. This object also contains geographic features and their attributes when used in a feature collection.
title: layer

___maxScale.description: Represents the maximum scale at which the layer definition will be applied.

___layerUrl.description: A string URL to a service that should be used for all queries against the layer. Used with hosted tiled map services on ArcGIS Online when there is an associated feature service that allows for queries.

___subLayerIds.description: If the layer is a parent layer, it will have one or more sub layers included in an array.

___showLegend.description: Indicates whether to allow map authors the ability to control what layers should be shown in a client's legend.

$eref.description: A featureSet object contains the geometry and attributes of features in a layer. This object is used with feature collections only.
$eref.title: featureSet

___features.description: An array of feature objects containing geometry and a set of attributes.

___featureSet.description: A featureSet object containing the geometry and attributes of the features in the layer. Used with feature collections only.

___title.description: A user-friendly string title for the layer that can be used in a table of contents.

___subLayer.description: Array of numeric values indicating the layer index for layers nested directly under the parent layer.

___defaultVisibility.description: Default visibility of the layers in the map service.

$eref.description: Contains information about an attribute field.
$eref.title: field

___name.description: A string defining the field name.

___editable.description: A Boolean defining whether this field is editable.

___type.description: A string defining the field type.

___alias.description: A string defining the field alias.

___length.description: A number defining how many characters are allowed in a string field.

___nullable.description: A Boolean defining whether this field can have a null value.

___exactMatch.description: A Boolean defining whether or not the field is an exact match.

___field.description: Information about each field in a layer. Used with feature collections.

___parentLayerId.description: If working with nested layers, this is the numeric value indicating the layer id of the next layer (parent) directly above the current referenced layer.

definitionEditor.parameterizedExpression: AREA BETWEEN {0} AND {1} or VALUE = 23 or NAME LIKE '{2}%'

$eref.description: The definitionEditor stores interactive filters at the same level as layerDefinition.
$eref.title: definitionEditor

___parameterizedExpression.description: A string value representing the where clause for the interactive filter.

___definitionEditor.description: An object that provides interactive filters.

$eref.description: Defines the look and feel of popup windows when a user clicks or queries a feature.
$eref.title: popupInfo

___mediaInfos.description: Array of various mediaInfo to display. Can be of type `image`, `piechart`, `barchart`, `columnchart`, or `linechart`. The order given is the order in which it displays.

___layerOptions.description: Additional options that can be defined for the popup layer.

___description.description: A string that appears in the body of the popup window as a description. It is also possible to specify the description as HTML-formatted content.

___relatedRecordsInfo.description: Indicates whether to enable related records if they exist on a layer.

___expressionInfos.description: List of Arcade expressions added to the pop-up.

___fieldInfos.description: Array of fieldInfo information properties. This information is provided by the service layer definition.

___title.description: A string that appears at the top of the popup window as a title.

___popupElements.description: An array of popupElement objects that represent an ordered list of popup elements.

___showAttachments.description: Indicates whether attachments will be loaded for feature layers that have attachments.

___popupInfo.description: A popupInfo object defining the popup window content for the layer.

$eref.description: An object that defines the attribute schema and drawing information for a layer drawn using client-side graphics.
$eref.title: layerDefinition

___definitionExpression.description: SQL-based definition expression string that narrows the data to be displayed in the layer.

___type.description: Indicates whether the layerDefinition applies to a Feature Layer or a Table.

___supportsRollbackOnFailureParameter.description: Boolean value indicating whether the layer supports rolling back edits made on a feature layer if some of the edits fail.

___hasM.description: Boolean value indicating whether layer has M values.

___geometryType.description: A string defining the type of geometry. Possible geometry types are: `esriGeometryPoint`, `esriGeometryMultipoint`, `esriGeometryPolyline`, `esriGeometryPolygon`, and `esriGeometryEnvelope`.

___spatialReference.description: An object containing the WKID or WKT identifying the spatial reference of the layer's geometry.

___supportsCalculate.description: Boolean value indicating whether the layer supports the Calculate REST operation when updating features.

___hasZ.description: Boolean value indicating whether layer has Z values.

___visibilityField.description: String value indicating the attribute field that is used to control the visibility of a feature. If applicable, when rendering a feature the client should use this field to control visibility. The field's values are 0 = do not display, 1 = display.

___hasStaticData.description: Boolean value indicating whether data changes. True if it does not.

___defaultVisibility.description: Boolean value indicating whether the layer's visibility is turned on.

___globalIdField.description: The unique identifier for a feature or table row within a geodatabase.

___fields.description: An array of field objects containing information about the attribute fields for the feature collection or layer.

___description.description: String value of the layer as defined in the map service.

___supportsValidateSql.description: Boolean value indicating whether the validateSQL operation is supported across a feature service layer.

___htmlPopupType.description: String value indicating the HTML popup type.

___currentVersion.description: Numeric value indicating the server version of the layer.

___isDataVersioned.description: Boolean value indicating whether the data is versioned.

___allowGeometryUpdates.description: Boolean value indicating whether the geometry of the features in the layer can be edited.

___capabilities.description: A comma separated list of supported capabilities, e.g. `Query,Editing`.

___featureReduction.description: An object that specifies how features are reduced or aggregated, with the goal of decluttering the view or presenting the user with an aggregate visualization. If unset, every feature is rendered individually.

___overrideSymbols.description: Dictates whether a client can support having an end user modify symbols on individual features.

___minScale.description: Represents the minimum scale at which the layer definition will be applied. This does not apply to layers of type: `ArcGISMapServiceLayer`, `ImageServiceVectorLayer` or `ImageServiceLayer`.

___drawingInfo.description: Contains drawing, labeling, and transparency information.

___maxScale.description: Represents the maximum scale at which the layer definition will be applied. This does not apply to layers of type: `ArcGISMapServiceLayer`, `ImageServiceVectorLayer` or `ImageServiceLayer`.

___extent.description: An object defining the rectangular area.

___typeIdField.description: Contains the name of the field holding the type ID for the features.

___displayField.description: A string value that summarizes the feature.

___maxRecordCount.description: Numeric value indicating tbe maximum number of records that will be returned at once for a query.

___supportsAttachmentsByUploadId.description: Boolean value indicating whether the layer supports uploading attachments with the Uploads operation. This can then be used in the Add Attachment and Update Attachment operations.

___types.description: Contains information about an attribute field.

___source.description: An object indicating the layerDefinition's layer source.

___supportsAdvancedQueries.description: Boolean value indicating whether the layer supports orderByFields in a query operation.

___objectIdField.description: Indicates the name of the object ID field in the dataset.

___name.description: Contains a unique name for the layer that can be displayed in a legend.

___supportedQueryFormats.description: String value indicating the output formats that are supported in a query.

___hasAttachments.description: Indicates whether attachments should be loaded for the layer.

___supportsStatistics.description: Boolean value indicating whether feature layer query operations support statistical functions.

___id.description: The identifier assigned to the layer.

___copyrightText.description: String value for the copyright text information for the layer.

___layerDefinition.description: The layerDefinition object defines the attribute schema and drawing information for the layer.

___id.description: A string indicating the index position of the layer in the map service or feature collection.

___minScale.description: Represents the minimum scale at which the layer definition will be applied.
